FuncDef: This command creates a NAT pool in the outside routing context. The nat pool defines the parameters that will be used for IP address and port translation within the pool.

ParaDef.Info: Specifies the NAT pool name, up to 32 characters.
Specifies the NAT group ID. Values-1 to 4.
This parameter must be specified to create the instance.
Species the pool type, either large-scale or L2-aware. Values-large-scale, l2-aware, wlan-gw-anchor.

This creation-time parameter configures the nat-pool for protocol agnostic operation. The IP addresses are translated in 1:1 fashion regardless of the protocol. No ports are translated for TCP or UDP traffic. Traffic through the pool can be initiated from inside or outside. When nat-pool is configured in agnostic mode, certain parameters in the pool are pre-set and cannot be changed:. Values-agnostic.
